Lithology is the study of rocks.

A Rock is a natural occuring solid cohesive aggregate of one or more mineral or mineral materials
Rocks can be devided into 3 major types based on the process of their formation
These are:
Igneous Rocks - formed through the solidification and cooling of magma in Volcanic areas. they are coined from word ignis meaning fire hence they are indicators of volcanism
Sedimentary rocks - formed by low temperature accumullation of sediments in tectonic basins and topographical sinks
metamophic rocks - formed at great depths but exposed to the surface due to erosion and epirogenic movements.
